greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) in which n-th row lists the parts i_1<i_2<...<i_m of the unique strict partition with encoding n = Product_{j=1..m} prime(i_j-j+1); n>=1, 1<=k<=A001222(n).
comment: A strict partition is a partition into distinct parts.
Row n=1 contains the parts of the empty partition, so it is empty.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..1000, flattened
mathematica: T[n_] := Function[l, Table[l[[j]]+j-1, {j, 1, Length[l]}]][Sort[ Flatten[ Table[ Array[ PrimePi[i[[1]]]&, i[[2]]], {i, FactorInteger[n]}]]]];
Table[T[n], {n, 1, 100}] // Flatten // Rest (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 23 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Last terms of rows give A252464 (for n>1).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 02 2015
